    • Constructor Detail

      • CoapRequest

        public CoapRequest(MsgType msgType,
           Code code,
           java.net.URI targetUri)
            throws InvalidMessageException,
                   ToManyOptionsException,
                   InvalidOptionException,
                   java.net.URISyntaxException
        This method creates a new Message object and uses the given parameters to create an appropriate header and initial option list with target URI-related options set.
        Parameters:
        msgType - The message type
        code - The message code
        targetUri - the recipients URI
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if one of the target URI options to be created is not valid
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the URI is not appropriate for a CoAP message
        ToManyOptionsException - if the target URI needs more than the maximum number of options per message
        InvalidMessageException - if the given code is not suitable for a request

    • Method Detail

      • getCallback

        public ResponseCallback getCallback()

      • getTargetUri

        public java.net.URI getTargetUri()
        Returns the messages target URI
        Returns:
        the messages target URI if the message is a request or null if its a response

      • setTargetURI

        public void setTargetURI(java.net.URI targetUri)
                  throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                         InvalidOptionException,
                         ToManyOptionsException
        This method sets all necessary target URI related options. This causes eventually already contained target URI related options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception. The URI host option will only be added if its not given as IP Address (IPv4 or IPv6). The URI port will only added if its not the CoAP standard port 5683. Nevertheless the methods getTargetURI and getOption(OptionName o) both return the given target IP address, respective the target port using the reconstructing strategy defined in the CoAP draft. Not to add default values as actual options avoids unnecessary traffic on the network and enables more useful options to be set in the option list which has a maximum size of 15.
        Parameters:
        targetUri - The absolute URI of the recipients service
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the given URI is not valid (e.g. not absolute)
        InvalidOptionException - if at least one of the options to be set is not valid.
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding all target URI options would exceed the maximum number of options per message.

      • setAccept

        public boolean setAccept(OptionRegistry.MediaType... mediaTypes)
                  throws InvalidOptionException,
                         ToManyOptionsException
        Set one option for each media type to be accepted as response payload. This causes eventually already contained accept options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Parameters:
        mediaTypes - the set of media types accepted as response payload
        Returns:
        true if accept options were succesfully set, false if accept option is not meaningful with the message code and thus silently ignored
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if at least one of the options to be added is not valid
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding all accept options would exceed the maximum number of options per message.

      • getProxyURI

        public java.net.URI getProxyURI()
                         throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Returns the contained Proxy URI
        Returns:
        the messages proxy URI (if any) or null otherwise
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException

      • setProxyURI

        public void setProxyURI(java.net.URI proxyURI)
                 throws InvalidOptionException,
                        java.net.URISyntaxException,
                        ToManyOptionsException
        Adds an appropriate number of proxy URI options to the list. This causes eventually already contained proxy URI options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Parameters:
        proxyURI - The proxy URI to be added as options
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if at least one of the options to be added is invalid
        java.net.URISyntaxException - if the given URI is not valid
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding all proxy URI options would exceed the maximum number of options per message.

      • setIfMatch

        public void setIfMatch(byte[]... etags)
                throws InvalidOptionException,
                       ToManyOptionsException
        Set one option for each ETAG enabling the computing of this requests payload on the server. This causes eventually already contained if-match options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Parameters:
        etags - the set of ETAGs enabling the computing of this messages payload
        Throws:
        InvalidOptionException - if at least one of the options to be added is not valid
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding all if-match options would exceed the maximum number of options per message.

      • setIfNoneMatch

        public void setIfNoneMatch()
                    throws ToManyOptionsException
        Set the if-non-match option. This causes eventually already contained if-non-match options to be removed from the list even in case of an exception.
        Throws:
        ToManyOptionsException - if adding an if-non-match options would exceed the maximum number of options per message.
